meanings.definition: To be excessively idle or lazy.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his homework, Tim decided to overidle on the couch all day.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overidle on weekends, preferring to relax rather than be productive.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to overidle in the sun, basking lazily without a care in the world.
meanings.sent4: His ambition overidled while he spent hours watching TV instead of working towards his goals.
meanings.sent5: The image of him overidling on the hammock under the shade was etched in her memory.

meanings.definition: To waste time or be unproductive.
meanings.sent1: Don't overidle your time away; make the most of every moment.
meanings.sent2: The employees were warned not to overidle during work hours.
meanings.sent3: She realized she had overidled the entire morning scrolling through social media.
meanings.sent4: His potential was overidling as he procrastinated on his important tasks.
meanings.sent5: The clock seemed to mock him as he continued to overidle instead of getting things done.

meanings.definition: To be inactive or not in use.
meanings.sent1: The old computer had been overidling in the corner for months.
meanings.sent2: The playground equipment overidled during the winter months when school was out.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten toys overidled in the attic, waiting to be played with again.
meanings.sent4: The garden tools overidled in the shed, untouched since last summer.
meanings.sent5: The dusty books overidled on the shelf, longing to be opened and read once more.
